alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; DuPage; Northern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 11:22AM CST until February 17 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...A period of wet snow, freezing rain, and sleet is expected late tonight. After a break in the accumulating wintry precipitation for most of Thursday morning, wind driven snow is expected Thursday afternoon and early evening. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, mainly near the lake. * WHERE...DuPage, Northern Cook and Central Cook Counties. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 9 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Wind driven snow will accumulate on roadways and result in hazardous travel conditions for the Thursday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow combined with strong winds could also put strain on tree limbs and power lines, which may result in some power outages.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
